page.title: 04Farming
page.content: The fairly level land is mainly a well drained quite fertile loam and gives rise to much arable farming, the main crops being wheat, barley and potatoes. Market Gardening for the Birmingham Conurbation is also important, cauliflowers, cabbages, peas and beans. Pick your own rasberries and strawberries is a recent development. There are a few dairy farms,a little cattle fattening. Temporary grass is used for silage. Several grass areas are used to graze horses kept for riding by local residents. At least three bee-keepers have hives, some are on farms to aid the fertilisation of fruit and a relatively new crop, oil seedrape.
